intro: Dodecatheon viscidum, commonly known as sticky leaf trillium, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its three broad, waxy leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and has a distinctive sticky coating on its leaves, which gives it its common name. Its flowers bloom in early spring and are pollinated by various insects, including bees and flies. The plant is also known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and is often found in forest understories.
